sentences.en: A security guard attempted to intervene, but was rebuffed.
sentences.cn: 一位保安人员试图干预, 但却被粗暴阻止.

sentences.en: Aunt Juley had to intervene again.
sentences.cn: 裘丽姑妈不得不再来拦阻.

sentences.en: But I won't intervene and it's your show.
sentences.cn: 不过,我不会插手的,这次是你登台表演.

sentences.en: Do not want to intervene in any unpleasant things.
sentences.cn: 不想介入任何不愉快的事情.

sentences.en: If there were a breakdown of law and order, the army might be tempted to intervene.
sentences.cn: 如果法治被践踏，军队可能会介入。

sentences.en: In the six years that intervened, I saw them once.
sentences.cn: 期间的六年中我见过他们一次。

sentences.en: It'seems inappropriate for us to intervene at this stage.
sentences.cn: 我们在此阶段介入似不甚妥.

sentences.en: Let such trifle not intervene between us.
sentences.cn: 不要让这样的小事介入我们之间.

sentences.en: Normally the Vatican does not intervene in the internal affairs of religious orders except in cases of disputed elections.
sentences.cn: 除非涉及一些有争议的选举，罗马教廷一般不会干预各教派的内部事务。

sentences.en: Sometimes the guardians intervene and break up lion hunters.
sentences.cn: 有时候卫士们会介入和阻止猎杀狮子的猎人.

sentences.en: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.cn: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.en: The existence of more than one agency with power to intervene can lead to children falling through the net.
sentences.cn: 多个部门都可干预的事实可能会导致一些孩子被遗漏。

sentences.en: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.cn: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

sentences.en: The security forces had to intervene to prevent the situation worsening.
sentences.cn: 安全部队不得不介入，以防止局势进一步恶化。

sentences.en: The situation calmed down when police intervened.
sentences.cn: 警察干预后，局势平静了下来。

sentences.en: Thus, our advice would have been to intervene earlier!
sentences.cn: 因此, 我们建议早点介入!

sentences.en: Unless some new laws of physics intervene, the matter will shrink down to a singular point.
sentences.cn: 除非有某些新的物理定律起作用, 否则物质将一直收缩到奇点.

sentences.en: When riot broke out, the police were obliged to intervene.
sentences.cn: 发生暴乱时, 警察有责任干预.

sentences.en: When rioting broke out, the police were obliged to intervene.
sentences.cn: 暴乱发生时, 警察有责任干预.

trans.tran_cn: 出面；介入，阻碍；干扰，插嘴，介于…之间
trans.tran_en: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

trans.tran_cn: 干涉， 调停， 干预； 插入， 介入； 干扰， 打扰
trans.tran_en: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens
